description: Vendor’s stock or catalog number for the item; used when ordering from the supplier. May include alphanumeric characters and leading zeros.
Sequence number for this vendor-item row, used to order multiple vendor options for the same item.
Internal identifier for the supplier providing this item.
Vendor classification or role for this item (likely manufacturer, distributor, etc.); confirm with SME.
Manufacturer’s model or part number associated with the item.
Brand or manufacturer name for the item as offered by the vendor.
Unit price associated with this vendor-item record (may represent list or sell price distinct from vendor cost); confirm definition with SME.
Expected procurement lead time from the vendor, likely in days; confirm unit with SME.
Default or minimum order quantity for this vendor item; unit aligns with vendor unit of measure; confirm with SME.
Priority ranking for sourcing from this vendor for the item (lower number typically indicates higher preference); confirm business rule with SME.
Internal inventory item identifier that this vendor record applies to.
Date when this vendor-item pricing or terms become effective.
Date when this vendor-item pricing or terms expire or become inactive.
Serial number for the specific unit, if tracked for this item; often blank for non-serialized parts; confirm use with SME.
Flag indicating whether this vendor record is active/usable in purchasing and planning; confirm allowed values with SME.
Indicates whether this is the primary/preferred vendor row for the item (Y/N).
Warehouse or stocking location code where this vendor relationship or pricing applies.
Vendor’s selling unit of measure used for ordering (e.g., EA, GAL).
Quantity contained in one vendor selling unit, used to convert to base units.
Unit purchase cost quoted by the vendor, in the organization’s currency.
Text description of the model or part as provided by the vendor or catalog.
User ID that created the vendor-item record.
Timestamp when the vendor-item record was created.
User ID that last updated the vendor-item record.
Timestamp when the vendor-item record was last updated.
